intro: Gouania colurnifolia, commonly known as the featherleaf gouania, is a species of flowering plant in the family Malvaceae. It is native to Central and South America, where it typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forests and stream banks. The plant features palmate leaves with deeply lobed segments, giving it a distinctive, feathery appearance. Its small, pale yellow flowers are borne in clusters and bloom during the rainy season. Gouania colurnifolia is often used in horticulture for its ornamental value and can thrive in well-drained soils with partial shade.
